ratings.comment: When Lucas lectures, it feels like you're talking with your older brother or best friend, except they are extremely knowledgeable and have decades of real world experience to tie into what you're learning. The course is very lean, no busy work and lectures cut right to what you need to know. Tests are free response questions graded pretty leniently
I loved Lucas Moore. I hope I get the chance to learn from him again. He actually cares about his students and his lectures are so interesting. Take him if you get the chance.

One of the best professors I have had--super nice, funny, and relatable. Always open to talking about class material or interesting research. His class made me want to become a substance use counselor and I learned so much about different drugs and substance use disorders. 10000/10

Literally amazing. Cares about his work and his students very much. The lectures were very engaging and always felt like I was learning something new. Assignments were always relevant to the material, and exams were easy if you just pay attention in lectures. Definitely recommend taking any class w/ him!

One of the best professors I've ever had at Madison.  Extremely respectful, caring, generous, and very knowledgeable and passionate about his teachings.  Tests are really fair, and in general this class caused me about 0 stress in total, felt like I was going to lectures by choice to learn about an interesting topic.  Can't recommend Lucas enough.

Professor Moore is super knowledgeable and happy to talk to students. He is very down to earth and conscious of his privilege. 
His class is clearly laid out, clear how he grades, and his lectures are recorded. (He uses the biopsychosocial approach to explain topics and has lots of videos he shows in class). 
Easily the best class and professor!

Professor Moore clearly knew what he was talking about but made everything easy to understand. Super relaxed and easygoing guy. You can tell he cares about everyone's input and respects different opinions. Grade is mostly determined by a few quizzes, 3 exams (short-answer), and a 2-4 page paper. Lectures are recorded. Overall not too much work
I loved class with Lucas! He is so knowledgeable about the topic and going to class was actually enjoyable.
Such a great professor and has so much real-life experience as a practicing therapist and working for the state! Would take another of his classes if I could. He really cares about his students.

I LOVED THIS COURSE! Professor Moore is passionate about the material and is very considerate of all experiences when speaking. He really knows what he is talking about but presents the material in a way where it's almost conversational, which is super cool. He wants you to do well, so the course layout/grading system is great :) 11/10 recommend!

Lucas is by far my favorite professor at UW thus far. His lectures are not only super inspiring, you can tell he genuenly cares about the material. 3 tests and one paper + 2 easy assignments. Tests are not difficult at all, and the paper is an opinionated one. TAKE THIS CLASS.

Class is super interesting, but he goes pretty fast in lectures and is a bit misleading about what's on the test which is frustrating. Overall a fair grader and if you're interested in the material, take the class! He posts his slides online which is really helpful.

He is a pretty down to earth guy. He likes to talk about his wife a lot, which is cute, but not necessarily in a substance abuse disorder class. He likes to get the class to interact with each other a lot which I like and he is easy to talk to/approach. He has readings for each lecture but they aren't always necessarily needed if you go to class.

Lucas is so awesome! First off, he's hot so I always want to go to class, but also his lectures are so entertaining. He explains everything so well. He's also a therapist so he can easily explain things to us and gives us anecdotes to help us understand concepts. No textbook, just light readings. Only one short paper, and 3-4 easy-ish exams.
Lucas is by far the best professor I have ever had at UW! He is so caring and respectful and makes classes so interesting. I took this class randomly and I highly recommend it to everyone!

It is apparent that Lucas is very passionate about drug/substance use disorders. The material is both interesting and applicable to social work practice. However, Lucas seems very self conscious about his teaching style and presents little to no challenge to his students.

Lucas is one of my favorite profs I've had. He's very political & speaks his mind. He shares his experience & is open to hearing anyone's thoughts. He takes feedback very seriously & tries to make class enjoyable for everyone. Lectures are enjoyable & video-filled. Tests are straight forward & the paper is not stressful unless you  don't prepare.

Lucas is one of the best professors I've had at UW. He is extremely passionate about the material and shares personal information to enhance students learning (but admits that he is only an expert in his OWN experience). He is professional but also personable and relates to college students very well. I took this class randomly, and its so WORTH IT

I really recommend this class! Not only is the course work super interesting, but Lucas is an AMAZING professor. He is extremely qualified despite being so young. He acknowledges his bias, and really enjoys class discussion. Exams are fair, mainly lecture focused! Took the class for fun and I do NOT regret it.
